newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel oil up on crude futures.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel oil up on crude futures.

text.p: European low-sulphur straight-run offers moved up slightly on Wednesday on the back of solid crude futures and with most of July's material sold, traders said.
They said few sellers were left on the market after a refiner sold a 25,000-tonne cargo to an end user at a price at the higher end of the quotes late on Tuesday.
One seller said he was at the $107 mark for 0.5-0.7 pct sulphur material while others were at $106 a tonne, or $1 up on a day earlier.
"With crude up 40 to 50 cents (yesterday) it's a natural progression for straight-run to go higher," a trader said.
"Also avails are low, most of the July material is gone now and its mid-month," the trader added.
Russian high sulphur straight run was steady to a little weaker with offers for three cargoes at two means plus $4.50/$5.50, compared with a deal on Tuesday at the higher price.
Traders said buying interest was weaker as refiners who cut runs recently have done most of their buying for now.
